data.title: Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

data.text:
Newcastle upon Tyne Presentation Nov 17

Country UK Town/City Newcastle upon Tyne Location Situated on the north bank of the River Tyne, in North East England. Population 300,000 Brief Description City and metropolitan borough of Tyne and Wear, the city was founded in the 2nd century. It owes its name to the castle built in 1080 by Robert II, Duke of Normandy, eldest son of William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 43.6 sq mi (113 km2). Industry Following closure of coal mining and shipbuilding industries the city is now largely a business and cultural centre. Culture/Sport Theatres (Theatre Royal, Journal Tyne Theatre, Northern Stage, Live Theatre, People’s Theatre), Utilita Arena, City Hall, Tyneside Cinema, museums and galleries (e.g. Centre for Life, Discovery Museum, Great North Museum, Laing Art Gallery), Literature and Philosophical Centre, Seven Stories children’s book archive, Chinatown, Newcastle ScienceFest (March), Evolution Festival (May), EAT (June), Northern Gay Pride Festival (July), Newcastle Mela (August),Football (Newcastle United FC); rugby union (Newcastle Falcons RFC), rugby league (Newcastle Thunder), basketball (Newcastle Eagles), starting point for Great North Run (September) and Blaydon Race (9 June). Tourism Castle Keep, Tyne Bridge, Millennium Bridge, Hadrian’s Wall, Eldon Square Shopping Centre, Quayside, bars, restaurants and night life.http://www.newcastlegateshead.com/ Education Newcastle University, Northumbria University, Newcastle College Newspaper Chronicle (http:// www.chroniclelive.co.uk/ , Sunday Sun (http://www.sundaysun.co.uk/) Mayor / Contact Details Lord Mayor – Councillor Veronica Dunn; Leader of the Council Councillor Nick Kemp nick.kemp@newcastle.gov.uk Chief Executive / Contact Details Pam Smith pam.smith@newcastle.gov.uk Website http://www.newcastle.gov.uk/

Here’s a link to a project from March 2021 when Newcastles of the World created and facilitated a fun introduction to “Geordie”, the dialect of the Newcastle upon Tyne area:

The quality of the Hyme Sweet Hyem film is better with its own recording (above) than when part of the longer project film recording.
